title: ASX ends session higher; Ardent Leisure shoots up after massive trade
text:
Lucas Baird

The S &P/ASX 200 Index has finished Tuesday trading session at 6672.2 points, up 19.7 points from the previous session or 0.3 per cent.

Resources explorer BHP Group led the growth with shares in the company moving up 1.2 per cent to $35.39. Fellow explorers South32 - hiking up 6.6 per cent to $2.60 - and Rio Tinto - ballooning 1.5 per cent to $89.43 - were also significant contributors.

National Australia Bank spin-off CYBG had the most substantial share price bump across the session as it ascended 9.6 per cent to $2.74.

On the other hand, it was Cochlear. The hearing aid manufacturer slumped 5.5 per cent to $202.42. Newcrest Mining and Wesfarmers also proved to be a drag on the bourse as they retreated to $32.59 and $40.32, respectively.

Super Retail Group; however, had the steepest slide with shares taking an 8.6 per cent battering to $8.74.
description: Amaysim rockets up as executive pay changes; Cochlear confident for re-trial in patent dispute; The ASX is up 0.3% to 6672.2 points at the end of trading.
